Tree limbs could be blown down and a few power outages may

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 9:02PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water On The Koyukuk River This Week... Heavy rain in the Brooks Range several days ago is causing high water and some flooding on the Upper Koyukuk River. The lower Koyukuk river will rise over the next several days and crest at Huslia on Wednesday or Thursday. Water levels will remain high as Huslia from Wednesday through next weekend.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 8:50PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water On The Chandalar River Through Monday... High water is now moving down the Chandalar River from heavy rain and heavy snowmelt in the Brooks Range several days ago. This high water will move downstream into the Yukon Flats tonight and Monday and could cause water to rise. Water will cover gravel bars and there will be lots of logs and other debris coming down

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 11 at 8:50PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...High Water On The Fortymile River Through Monday... The Fortymile River saw very sharp rises in the river Saturday night and Sunday from heavy rain that fell on Saturday. No flooding was reported, but the river got high and covered some gravel bars. There will be lots of logs and other debris coming down the river.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country

entry.title: Severe Weather Statement issued June 12 at 8:29AM MDT until June 15 at 6:00AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...THE SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING FOR NORTHWESTERN PUEBLO COUNTY WILL EXPIRE AT 830 AM MDT... The storm which prompted the warning has weakened below severe limits, and has exited the warned area. Therefore, the warning will be allowed to expire. However small hail, gusty winds and heavy rain are still possible with this thunderstorm.

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 8:28AM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern El Paso and northwestern Pueblo Counties through 900 AM MDT... At 828 AM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Pueblo West, or 16 miles northwest of Pueblo, moving north at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and nickel size hail.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Colorado Springs Vicinity, Southern El Paso County, Rampart Range Below 7400 Ft; Pueblo Vicinity, Pueblo County Below 6300 Feet

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 4:41AM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: High temperatures today and Tuesday are expected to be in the lower and middle 90s across the area. The higher temperatures combined with increasing humidities will allow for heat index values to be between 103 and 107 across much of the area.
